name: ListGithubRepoSecretAlerts
description:
Retrieve secret scanning alerts for a GitHub repository.

Call this tool to get a list of secret scanning alerts for a specified GitHub repository. It requires administrator access and a personal access token with proper scopes (repo or security_events). Suitable for monitoring sensitive data exposure in repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: alerts_state_filter
parameters.description: Filter alerts by their state: `open` or `resolved`. Specify to list only alerts in a specific state.

value_schema.description: Set to `open` or `resolved` to only list secret scanning alerts in a specific state.

parameters.name: filter_by_secret_type
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of secret types to return. By default, all secret types are included.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of secret types to return. By default all secret types are returned.
See "[Secret scanning patterns](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/code-security/secret-scanning/secret-scanning-patterns#supported-secrets-for-advanced-security)"
for a complete list of secret types.

parameters.name: secret_alert_resolutions_filter
parameters.description: Comma-separated resolutions to filter alerts. Valid values: `false_positive`, `wont_fix`, `revoked`, `pattern_edited`, `pattern_deleted`, `used_in_tests`.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of resolutions. Only secret scanning alerts with one of these resolutions are listed. Valid resolutions are `false_positive`, `wont_fix`, `revoked`, `pattern_edited`, `pattern_deleted` or `used_in_tests`.

parameters.name: sort_results_by_property
parameters.description: Specifies the property to sort alerts: use 'created' for creation date, or 'updated' for last update or resolution date.

value_schema.description: The property to sort the results by. `created` means when the alert was created. `updated` means when the alert was updated or resolved.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Specifies the direction to sort the results ('asc' for ascending, 'desc' for descending).

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: Specifies the page number of the secret scanning alerts to retrieve. Use this to paginate results.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of secret scanning alerts to return per page, with a maximum of 100 items.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: cursor_before_event
parameters.description: Search for events only before this cursor. Leave empty to get the initial cursor.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for events before this cursor. To receive an initial cursor on your first request, include an empty "before" query string.

parameters.name: events_after_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for paginated results to fetch events occurring after this point. Use an empty value to receive the initial cursor.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for events after this cursor.  To receive an initial cursor on your first request, include an empty "after" query string.
